body:
Hi @julramos - thanks for raising the issue! 

I think you have correctly identified the problem here. Would you like to open a PR and see if that fixes the issue? 

An alternative quick fix would be to set `d=0` if this is acceptable:
```python
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sktime.transformations.series.impute import Imputer
from sktime.forecasting.arima import AutoARIMA
from sktime.datasets import load_airline

y = load_airline()
y.iloc[np.random.randint(0, len(y), 20)] = np.nan  # add missing values
transformer = Imputer(method="forecaster", forecaster=AutoARIMA(d=0, suppress_warnings=True))
y_hat = transformer.fit_transform(y)
```

issue.title: Fix fh in imputer method based on in-sample forecasts

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look
at our contribution guide: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs

Fixes #859.

<!--
Example: Fixes #1234. See also #3456.

Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->


#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.

When using a forecaster to impute data, the class `Imputer` was passing all the points to `forecaster.predict()`. This could throw the error "ValueError: In-sample predictions undefined for start=0 when d=1" when using `forecaster = AutoARIMA()`. I changed the code to pass only the points containing NaN to `forecaster.predict()`.

<!--
A clear and concise description of what you have implemented.
-->

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?

No.

<!--
If your contribution does add a new hard dependency, we may suggest to initially develop your contribution in a separate companion package in https://github.com/sktime/ to keep external dependencies of the core sktime package to a minimum.
-->

#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?

Nothing in particular.

<!-- This section is particularly useful if you have a pull request that is still in development. You can guide the reviews to focus on the parts that are ready for their comments. We suggest using bullets (indicated by * or -) and filled checkboxes [x] here -->

#### Any other comments?

No. 
<!--
Please be aware that we are a loose team of volunteers so patience is necessary; assistance handling other issues is very welcome. We value all user contributions, no matter how minor they are. If we are slow to review, either the pull request needs some benchmarking, tinkering, convincing, etc. or more likely the reviewers are simply busy. In either case, we ask for your understanding during the review process.
-->

#### PR checklist
<!--
Please go through the checklist below. Please feel free to remove points if they are not applicable.
-->

##### For all contributions
- [ ] I've added myself to the [list of contributors](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/.all-contributorsrc).
- [ ] Optionally, I've updated sktime's [CODEOWNERS](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CODEOWNERS) to receive notifications about future changes to these files.
- [ ] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.


<!--
Thanks for contributing!
-->

rename.from: [BUG] In-sample predictions undefined for start=0 when d=1 when using Imputer with AutoARIMA
rename.to: ARIMA and AutoARIMA should return pandas.NA when value cannot be predicted, e.g., first index in-sample for start=0, d=1

body:
Reopening with @ilyasmoutawwakil's suggestion that forecasts at indices which the forecaster cannot predict should be NA.

Since we are returning pandas objects, it should be `pandas.NA`, and the column/entry of a nullable `pandas` `dtype`.
I can make a PR for this if no one did yet ^^

@fkiraly 
okay so I made a piece of code to make it work for the case when given elements of ForcastingHorizon that can't be predicted (when arima order > 0) while also raising an error if ever asked to forecast for something before the train data. However there's a small problem with intervals. When `return_pred_int` is false, `_predict_in_sample` returns a pd.Series but when it's True, it return a tuple (pd.Series, pd.DataFrame) which raises the append error. Note that this issue is from the current sktime version (I ran it on colab to make sure) and is only asking for values that can be predicted. Should I correct it in the same PR ? (it's just a two line of code). I made a separate issue for it #1441

issue.title: Pandas.NA for unpredictible insample forecasts

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
> #### Reference Issues/PRs
Fixes #859 and #1441 


#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
When training an AutoArima you don't know what differencing order it'll land at so if data changes at some point you won't be able to do in sample forecasts for some points (earlier to diff order). This implementation makes predictions possible (without errors) if they're ealier to differencing order.
It also fixes a small problem with appending out of sample to in sample predictions when intervals are to be returned.

> #### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?

Nope

> #### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?

if the code is clear enough, if the comments should be left.

> #### PR checklist


> ##### For all contributions

- [x] I've added myself to the [list of contributors](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/.all-contributorsrc).
- [ ] Optionally, I've updated sktime's [CODEOWNERS](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CODEOWNERS) to receive notifications about future changes to these files.
- [ ] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.

> ##### For new estimators

- [ ] I've added the estimator to the online documentation.
- [ ] I've updated the existing example notebooks or provided a new one to showcase how my estimator works.
